data.title: What is Wix | Who Owns the Wix App?
data.meta_description: Unravel the mystery behind the ownership of the popular web-building platform as we delve into the corporate structure and key players that make Wix App tick.
data.text:
Welcome to our blog, Today, we're diving into something that's on a lot of people's minds these days - Wix. It's a big name in website building, but what do we really know about it? Who created Wix? Who owns it? And where are they located?

We'll be digging into all this, plus a look at Wix's yearly performance to see how it's doing. We'll also talk about what it costs to use Wix, so you can decide if it's the right choice for you.

Get ready to learn everything you need to know about Wix; stay tuned.

What Exactly is Wix?

Unleash your digital creativity with Wix, a state-of-the-art web development platform powered by the cloud. With its effortless drag-and-drop interface, you can craft beautiful HTML5 websites and responsive mobile sites without a hitch.

Whether you're constructing a sleek blog or an extensive online store, Wix caters to your unique needs. Ideal for personal ventures, business enterprises, captivating portfolios, and stirring events, Wix offers endless possibilities.

Plus, with a vast selection of customizable templates and a powerful set of tools for website management and promotion, you're well-equipped to make your digital presence shine.

When did Wix.com found and who Owns the Wix App?

Wix.com was founded in 2006. It was initially designed as a platform for building Flash-based websites, but it shifted to HTML5 in 2012.

Wix was created by Avishai Abrahami, Nadav Abrahami, and Giora Kaplan. The idea for Wix came to them while they were building a website for another startup idea.

Wix was founded by three tech-savvy friends who were frustrated with the difficulty of creating a website. They decided to build a platform that would make it easy for anyone to create a website, regardless of their coding or design skills.

Who Owns Wix and Where is Wix Headquarter Situated?

Wix is a renowned software company based in Israel that specializes in web development services. The question of "who owns Wix" is answered by its public listing; Wix is publicly owned, with shares traded on the NASDAQ.

The company was founded by Avishai Abrahami, Nadav Abrahami, and Giora Kaplan, who first envisioned Wix while attempting to simplify the process of website creation. This trio remains influential in the company's direction, supported by a global team across offices in 15 countries, including Israel, Brazil, Canada, Germany, India, Ireland, Japan, Lithuania, Poland, the Netherlands, the United States, Ukraine, and Singapore.

It's user-friendly and doesn't require any technical expertise. Wix is a public company in the US and has offices in 15 countries around the world, including Israel, Brazil, Canada, Germany, India, Ireland, Japan, Lithuania, Poland, the Netherlands, the United States, Ukraine, and Singapore.

Yearly Performance of Wix.com

In 2006, the birth of Wix marked a new era of web development, offering intuitive, user-friendly tools for online creation.

The platform quickly gained momentum, reaching one million users by 2009. Not resting on its laurels, Wix continued to innovate and expand, launching a Flash Editor in 2008 that transformed the way users interacted with the platform.

By 2012, Wix had firmly stepped into the HTML5 era, offering a new HTML5 editor and unveiling an app market that provided an array of tools and add-ons to empower its users. Two years later, Wix had blossomed into a thriving community of 50 million users.

Wix went public in 2013, listed on NASDAQ, signaling a significant milestone in its journey. The following years were filled with innovation and growth, launching a fresh new Editor in 2015 and introducing Wix ADI, a revolutionary artificial design intelligence tool, in 2016.

As the user base continued to grow, reaching 150 million in 2019, Wix launched Velo, a full-stack development platform. In the same vein of continued growth and development, 2018 saw the introduction of Ascend, a complete business solution for entrepreneurs and small businesses.

By 2021, Wix's global impact was evident, boasting 200 million users worldwide. The year also saw the launch of Editor X, a sophisticated design and layouting tool, marking yet another innovation in Wix's journey.

As the years go by, Wix continues to evolve, offering users an ever-expanding suite of tools to bring their visions to life on the web.

Pricing Plan for Wix.com

To see pricing plans, Just head over to wix.com. Once you are on the official website of Wix, click on âPricing.â

This will direct you to a comprehensive overview of the plans available, allowing you to make an informed decision based on your needs and budget.

3 Wix Plans

Wix offers three plans:

Website Plan: Ideal for showcasing a professional site. It includes a free domain for one year and 14GB of storage space.

Business and eCommerce Plans: Essential for accepting online payments. These plans offer advanced business features, including an online store, unlimited bandwidth, and up to 50GB of storage space.

Enterprise Plans: Built for large-scale businesses, with VIP support, personalized pricing, and high-performance infrastructure.

Choose the plan that best suits your website's needs and budget.

In the world of web development platforms, cost is often a critical factor. Each person has unique needs and budgets to consider, making the availability of flexible pricing plans a valuable feature.

Wix shines in this regard, offering a variety of pricing options to cater to everyone, from individuals to established businesses. You may wonder, "How Much Is Wix: Pricing & Comparison?" - a question that we aim to answer comprehensively in this discussion.

We invite you to explore this topic in depth through our dedicated section, where you'll find a detailed breakdown of Wix's pricing structure and how it compares with other platforms in the market.

Navigate to our detailed guide [How Much Is Wix: Pricing & Comparison] to better understand how Wix can offer value that suits your needs and fits within your budget.

Wrapping Up

Wix is a powerful web development platform that enables users to unleash their digital creativity. With its user-friendly drag-and-drop interface, users can effortlessly create stunning HTML5 websites and mobile sites for various purposes. Wix offers a wide range of customizable templates, robust website management tools, and effective promotion features.

Founded in 2006 by Avishai Abrahami, Nadav Abrahami, and Giora Kaplan, Wix has grown exponentially, attracting millions of users worldwide.

It went public on NASDAQ in 2013 and has continuously introduced innovative features like the HTML5 editor, app market, Wix ADI, Velo, Ascend, and Editor X.

Wix provides flexible pricing plans to cater to different needs and budgets, whether for personal projects, eCommerce ventures, or enterprise solutions. Overall, Wix remains a leading web development platform that empowers users to succeed in the digital world.

FAQs

When was wix created?

Wix was founded in 2006 by Avishai Abrahami, Nadav Abrahami, and Giora Kaplan. The platform was initially developed to simplify the process of building websites using a drag-and-drop interface.

Where is wix from?

Wix is from Israel. The company was founded there and its headquarters are located in Tel Aviv.
